title: Live briefing: Israeli strikes kill 52 across Lebanon; Hungary vows to disregard ICC warrants
content: Prime Minister Viktor Orban said he would invite his Israeli counterpart, Benjamin Netanyahu, to visit Hungary in defiance of the International Criminal Court’s warrant.
summary: Prime Minister Viktor Orban said he would invite his Israeli counterpart, Benjamin Netanyahu, to visit Hungary in defiance of the International Criminal Court’s warrant.

title: Israeli strikes kill five paramedics in Lebanon, health authorities say
Russia seeks to intimidate Ukraine with new missile, officials say
content: The attack with an intermediate-range ballistic missile has spurred fears of a major escalation in the ongoing war and prompted Ukraine to request new air defenses.
summary: The attack with an intermediate-range ballistic missile has spurred fears of a major escalation in the ongoing war and prompted Ukraine to request new air defenses.

title: Cartel leader who faked own death is arrested in California, officials say
content: Cristian Fernando Gutierrez-Ochoa, alleged son-in-law of “El Mencho,” the leader of the Mexican Cártel de Jalisco Nueva Generación (CJNG), was arrested in Riverside.
summary: Cristian Fernando Gutierrez-Ochoa, alleged son-in-law of “El Mencho,” the leader of the Mexican Cártel de Jalisco Nueva Generación (CJNG), was arrested in Riverside.

Meet Lucy, the celebrity of fossils, who changed our view of evolution
content: A collection of 3-million-year-old bones unearthed 50 years ago in Ethiopia changed our understanding of human origins.

title: American businessman makes play for Russian natural gas pipelines
content: An American businessman is seeking to acquire the Swiss company that controls Russia’s Nord Stream 2, according to documents obtained by The Washington Post.
summary: An American businessman is seeking to acquire the Swiss company that controls Russia’s Nord Stream 2, according to documents obtained by The Washington Post.

title: How a change in rice farming unexpectedly made India’s air so much worse
content: No one anticipated that an initiative to save groundwater by delaying the annual rice season would aggravate northern India’s already miserable air pollution.
summary: No one anticipated that an initiative to save groundwater by delaying the annual rice season would aggravate northern India’s already miserable air pollution.

title: ICC warrants put spotlight on Israel and its U.S. defenders
content: Many Western countries — including stalwart U.S. and Israeli allies — called for the International Criminal Court’s ruling against Israel’s Benjamin Netanyahu to be respected.
summary: Many Western countries — including stalwart U.S. and Israeli allies — called for the International Criminal Court’s ruling against Israel’s Benjamin Netanyahu to be respected.

title: U.S. case against Adani targets a close ally of Indian prime minister
content: Adani is seen as an arm of Indian domestic and foreign policy — and a proxy for Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
summary: Adani is seen as an arm of Indian domestic and foreign policy — and a proxy for Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

title: Israel and U.S. condemn ICC arrest warrants; other nations vow to enforce
content: The court issued warrants for Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and the former defense minister “for crimes against humanity and war crimes.” It also issued a warrant for a Hamas military leader.
summary: The court issued warrants for Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and the former defense minister “for crimes against humanity and war crimes.” It also issued a warrant for a Hamas military leader.

title: President Joe Biden called the ICC’s issuance of arrest warrants against Israeli leaders “outrageous.”

title: ICC arrest warrants accuse Netanyahu, Gallant of war crimes in Gaza
content: The International Criminal Court said the alleged crimes include starvation as a method of warfare, murder, persecution and other inhumane acts.

title: What the ICC arrest warrants mean for Netanyahu and Gallant
content: The warrants for Netanyahu and Gallant could affect their international travel, as some European leaders affirmed they would uphold their obligations as member states of the court.

Iceland volcano spews glowing lava in seventh eruption in a year
content: The eruption — the 10th on the Reykjanes Peninsula since 2021 — began with little warning. The nearby town of Grindavik and the Blue Lagoon were evacuated.

Billionaire Gautam Adani indicted in New York in alleged bribery scheme

title: Paws up! Police find shoe thief at a kindergarten is actually a weasel.
content: Police in southwest Japan installed cameras after nearly two dozen children’s shoes went missing from Gosho Kodomo-en kindergarten in Fukuoka. The culprit? A weasel.
summary: Police in southwest Japan installed cameras after nearly two dozen children’s shoes went missing from Gosho Kodomo-en kindergarten in Fukuoka. The culprit? A weasel.

title: Fearing war, Georgia chooses a return to Russia’s embrace
content: The pro-Russian ruling party claimed victory in an election rife with violations with the message that angering Moscow risks turning Georgia into another Ukraine.
summary: The pro-Russian ruling party claimed victory in an election rife with violations with the message that angering Moscow risks turning Georgia into another Ukraine.

title: Who is Gautam Adani? Indian billionaire hit with fraud charges in U.S.

title: Brazil marks Black Consciousness Day, a new holiday, for first time
content: The holiday marks the anniversary of the death of Zumbi, a key figure in Black resistance to slavery in Brazil.
summary: The holiday marks the anniversary of the death of Zumbi, a key figure in Black resistance to slavery in Brazil.

title: Can Lebanon’s army secure the south? A cease-fire deal could depend on it.
content: The readiness of Lebanon’s army is a matter of growing urgency as the Biden administration makes a new push for an end to the war between Israel and Hezbollah.

title: U.S. Embassy in Kyiv closes over attack fears after Ukraine strikes Russia
content: The announcement came a day after Ukraine used U.S.-supplied missiles to strike inside Russia, raising fears of retaliation against the capital.
summary: The announcement came a day after Ukraine used U.S.-supplied missiles to strike inside Russia, raising fears of retaliation against the capital.

title: What are antipersonnel mines, widely banned weapons Biden is giving Ukraine?
content: President Joe Biden agreed to provide antipersonnel land mines to Ukraine as Russian troops advance. The weapon is banned in over 160 countries.
summary: President Joe Biden agreed to provide antipersonnel land mines to Ukraine as Russian troops advance. The weapon is banned in over 160 countries.
